item.title: [Support Classes Suggestions] The Guardian/The Warden , The Dragon , The Mortician/The Undertaker
item.dc:creator: Neclord
item.description:
NAOtheRitualist:

The Mortician

Blue Dragon Support

Passive (The Truth) - Upon death , your true class and logs will be revealed.(Bypasses Defile and Facelift )

Day Ability (Identify) - Get a dead player’s real class.(3 Uses)

Night Ability (Dead’s Call) - Get a player’s feedback from Night 1 until Death.(Infinite Uses)
Goal: Defeat The Unseen/The Cult and any Neutrals that seek you harm.

Converts into:

The Undertaker

Unseen Support

Day Ability (Facelift) - If you die , you will appear as the chosen class.(Infinite Uses)

Night Ability (Expertise) - All players visiting The Assassin will be occupied.(1 Use)
Night Ability (Excuse) - Delete a dead player’s logs.(2 Uses)
Goal: Defeat The Blue Dragon and any Neutrals that seek you harm.

I like this concept but there is nothing present in his abilities that suggest he’s a support class. Blue Dragon variant is more geared as an investigative class and Unseen variant is more geared as an offensive class. Being an investigative weakens the ability for scorned to claim it and strengthens the ability for Mastermind to claim it. Mastermind currently struggles forming a safe claim. This would certainly help out on that front.

There are two solutions to this: Add some kind of supportive ability (be it protecting a player of your choosing through some means or empowering a user of your choosing) to justify its label of Support, or simply to make it an Investigative class.

Also, does Undertaker’s facelift apply if executed during the day? Would be a very interesting ability if so.

item.title: [Support Classes Suggestions] The Guardian/The Warden , The Dragon , The Mortician/The Undertaker
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
NAOtheRitualist:

Day Ability (Ready to Help) - Make a player Immune to Negative Effects(Frame, Mindwarp , Reap, Nightshade, Bleeding, Conversion, Occupation & Redirection).(1 Use- Can NOT Target The King or yourself. This effect wears off after 1 night.)

CW barrier 2: It’s still an unfun ability boogaloo. It may be a good “low-power” ability in terms of impact but the problems with it lie in how it’s much harder to use it in an interesting way compared to heal.

NAOtheRitualist:

Night Ability (Step In) - Redirect all negative effects targeting a player. The Redirected Effects will go to the player that used them.(Infinite Uses)

This is just a rephrasing of the day ability. The only class this would actually affect badly is Reaper, making the class a blatant Reaper hardcounter.

Overall: It’s just old CW but without the potential to use a fun ability like Tornado that utterly fucks over Reaper sometimes instead.

Solution: The night ability needs to be replaced with something much more interesting and non-confirmable.

NAOtheRitualist:

Passive (Shielded) - Immune to Bleeding and Nightshade .

Basically pointless and just serves to make them somewhat hunterproof.

NAOtheRitualist:

Day Ability (Ready to “Help”) - Make a player weak to Negative Effects(Frame, Mindwarp , Reap, Nightshade, Bleeding, Conversion, Occupation & Redirection).(1 Use - Can NOT target The King or yourself. This effect wears off after 1 night.)

Far too niche of an ability to be used in an interesting way again. I can’t really say anything else.

NAOtheRitualist:

Night Ability (Watchful) - Kill all Investigative classes visiting your Unseen members.(2 Uses - Any Investigative classes visiting you will not die.)

Pro-tip: Giving the Unseen extra kill power, even if potenitally outs the entire Unseen, is reeeeallly dumb. This could have a potential 7KPN at maximum, which is utterly ludircrous as a mere possiblity (2 obs, 2 princess, 2 sheriffs, 1 inquisitor).

NAOtheRitualist:

Night Ability (Do It Yourself) - Kill The Assassin ’s target instead of them.(1 Use - You will become Immune to Occupation and Redirection. The Observer will see you visiting the target)

if we’re going to have an ability like this I’d muuch rather just remove Assassin altogether and make the Unseen kill factional. Not that that should ever actually happen.

It’s a decent ability but feels a bit off.

Overall: Not a very good convert, extremely swingy abilities and hard to use interestingly at all.

Solutions: A complete rework, I’m afraid. Do it yourself is the only ability I’d keep.

believe it or not, I actually kinda like the Dragon. If Fire Breath was removed and replaced with something different it’d be a pretty decent class.

NAOtheRitualist:

Passive (The Truth) - Upon death , your true class and logs will be revealed.(Bypasses Defile and Facelift )

Far too niche of an ability, it basically does nothing half the time.

NAOtheRitualist:

Day Ability (Identify) - Get a dead player’s real class.(3 Uses)

basically a Possessor hardcounter

NAOtheRitualist:

Night Ability (Dead’s Call) - Get a player’s feedback from Night 1 until Death.(Infinite Uses)

Forensic Investigator is a pretty overpowered ability imo, so uhhhhh no. also this is blatantly investigative and not support.

Overall: Unfortunately, due to the low amount of tailoring flips in the game I’d say it’s a broken concept. Sorry.

NAOtheRitualist:

Day Ability (Facelift) - If you die , you will appear as the chosen class.(Infinite Uses)

an interesting ability but I’m not certain how it would work out. I’d need to see it tried in a game before making a judgement on it.

NAOtheRitualist:

Night Ability (Expertise) - All players visiting The Assassin will be occupied.(1 Use)

A decent ability, I guess? It has some interesting applications but seems kinda monotonous to use.

NAOtheRitualist:

Night Ability (Excuse) - Delete a dead player’s logs.(2 Uses)

The diamond in the rough ability. I really like this one tbh.

Overall: an actually pretty decent convert. No real complaints here.
